newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end sharply lower after election.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end sharply lower after election.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed sharply lower on Monday after rounds of profit-taking ate away gains posted last week in anticipation of Lower House elections on Sunday, brokers said. Turnover was small as investors retreated into a wait-and-see stance, they added.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 average sank 309.35 points, or 1.43 percent, to settle at 21,302.95. Its December futures were down 390 points at 21,310.
"The profit-taking was accelerated by disappointment that the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) did not win a majority," said Akihiro Naemura, strategist at Okasan Securities.
